intro: Mesembryanthemum subcompressum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its fleshy, often blue-green leaves are adapted to store water, making it drought-tolerant. The flowers bloom in shades of yellow, orange, and red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
